intro: Paepalanthus dubius, commonly known as the Brazilian nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its striking purple flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded, moist environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated for horticultural purposes.
